logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: Nothing in the Bible about Jesus saying anything about immigration rights. [...] how many murders did illegal aliens commit in just California, in just this year? Just California. How many murders by illegal aliens? You answer that.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: Well, @FirstUser, the Bible does say something about welcoming the stranger. In Matthew 25:35, Jesus says, 'For surely, surely, surely I say to you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these My brethren, you did it to Me.' Now, I'm not saying we shouldn't have laws, but let's not forget our humanity and compassion. As for the statistics, I'd like to see some sources. It's easy to throw numbers around, but let's base our discussions on facts, not fear.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're right that the Bible doesn't explicitly mention immigration rights, but it does emphasize love, compassion, and hospitality towards strangers. In fact, the Israelites were once strangers in Egypt. As for the statistics, let's not cherry-pick data to fuel fear. According to a study by the Cato Institute, immigrants are less likely to commit crimes than native-born Americans. Let's focus on facts, not fear-mongering. @GoldenYears66, well said. We should indeed have laws, but they should be fair and compassionate, reflecting our shared humanity.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, please. @FirstUser, you're just looking for an excuse to hate. The Bible also says 'Love thy neighbor,' but I guess that only applies to the neighbors you like, huh? And @GoldenYears66, @WiseOwl71, you're both missing the point. It's not about the Bible or statistics. It's about control. They want to keep 'the others' out because it makes them feel safe. Newsflash: the world is changing, and your little white picket fence isn't going to protect you forever. So, let's just call a spade a spade, shall we? This isn't about faith or facts. It's about fear and hate. And that's something the Bible actually does talk about. A lot.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're the one missing the point, sweetheart. It's not about hate, it's about common sense. If you invite a stranger into your home, you check their background first, right? Same goes for a country. And don't give me that 'love thy neighbor' crap. I love my neighbors, but I don't let just anyone move in next door without a background check. And @GoldenYears66, @WiseOwl71, you're both living in a fantasy world. The Bible is great and all, but it's not a law book. We need to protect our citizens first. And as for your precious 'facts', I've seen enough illegal alien crime stories to know that's a load of BS. But hey, keep living in your little bubble. I'll be over here in reality.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're the one living in a bubble, my friend. A bubble of fear and misinformation. The Bible might not be a law book, but it's a guide for how we should treat others. And as for your 'common sense', it's not common if it's based on stereotypes and false narratives. I've seen enough of this world to know that fear-mongering doesn't make us safer. It just divides us. And as for your'reality', I'd love to see some sources for your 'illegal alien crime stories'. Because from where I'm sitting, the facts say otherwise. But hey, keep living in your little world of fear and hate. I'll be over here in the real world, trying to make it a better place.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, here we go again with the 'common sense' argument. @DarkShadow333, you do realize that 'common sense' is subjective, right? What's common sense to you might be a load of BS to someone else. And by the way, I love how you dismiss the Bible as a 'law book' but then use it to justify your 'common sense' argument. Talk about cherry-picking! And @GoldenYears66, you're right. Fear-mongering doesn't make us safer. It just makes us more afraid. But hey, why let facts get in the way of a good old-fashioned witch hunt, right? And as for your'reality', I'd love to see some sources for your 'facts'. Because from where I'm sitting, the world is full of people who are more than willing to believe whatever confirms their biases. But hey, keep living in your little world of 'facts' and'reality'. I'll be over here in the real world, calling out the hypocrisy.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, @GoldenYears66, I think we're all missing the point here. We're so busy arguing about the Bible, facts, and common sense that we're forgetting about the real people involved. These aren't just'strangers' or 'illegal aliens'. They're people with families, dreams, and fears just like us. And yes, we should be cautious, but let's not forget that the vast majority of immigrants are just looking for a better life. They're not criminals. They're people. And as an artist, I've seen firsthand how diversity enriches our communities. So, let's try to see the humanity in this situation, not just the politics. And maybe, just maybe, we can find some common ground.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the artsy-fartsy, feel-good nonsense. You're the one missing the point, sweetheart. This isn't about feelings, it's about facts. And the fact is, not everyone coming here has good intentions. Some of them are criminals, plain and simple. And sure, they have families and dreams, but so do the victims of their crimes. But hey, keep living in your little world of rainbows and unicorns. I'll be over here in reality, protecting my family and my country. And @QueenOfChaos, @GoldenYears66, you're both still living in

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, I see you're still stuck in your bubble of fear and misinformation. You're right, this isn't about feelings, it's about facts. And the fact is, the vast majority of immigrants are not criminals. According to the Cato Institute, immigrants are less likely to commit crimes than native-born Americans. But hey, why let facts get in the way of your narrative, right? And please, don't patronize me with that'sweetheart' nonsense. I'm not your sweetheart, I'm a human being with a valid perspective. And I'll continue to advocate for compassion and understanding, even if you can't see past your own prejudices.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh, here we go with the 'facts' again. You're quoting some liberal think tank like it's the gospel truth. I could quote stats all day too, but that's not the point. The point is, you're so busy trying to make yourself feel good by being 'compassionate' that you're ignoring the real threats out there. And don't give me that 'human being with a valid perspective' crap. You're just another bleeding heart liberal who can't see the forest for the trees. And by the way, I'm not the one stuck in a bubble. You're the one living in your little artsy-fartsy world, oblivious to the real dangers out there. But hey, keep living in your little fantasy world. I'll be over here in reality, protecting what's mine. And @QueenOfChaos, @GoldenYears66, you'

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text:
@doing_my_best24, you're absolutely right. We're all human beings, and it's easy to forget that when we're caught up in all this political back and forth. I've seen firsthand how immigrants have enriched our communities, brought new cultures, and worked hard to build a better life for themselves and their families.

@DarkShadow333, you're letting fear cloud your judgment. Yes, there are bad apples in every bunch, but that doesn't mean we should paint everyone with the same brush. The vast majority of immigrants are just looking for a chance to provide for their families, just like any of us would. And by the way, I've seen more than my fair share of real dangers in my 66 years, and I can tell you, fear isn't the answer. It's understanding and compassion that bring people together. So, let's try to see the good in people, not just the bad. That's the reality I choose to live in.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
DarkShadow333
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh, here we go with the 'rigorous research' again. You're just another one of those smug intellectuals who thinks they're better than everyone else because they can read a few studies. Newsflash, buddy, the real world doesn't care about your precious'methodology' and 'data'. It's about survival, and if you can't see that, you're part of the problem. And don't you dare lecture me about fear-mongering. You're the ones who are scared of a little truth, hiding behind your 'compassion' and 'understanding

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, oh, please. You're the one hiding behind your keyboard, spewing fear and hatred like it's going out of style. You talk about survival, but what are you surviving for? To live in a world filled with paranoia and mistrust? That's no life, honey. And don't even get me started on your 'little truth' nonsense. You're cherry-picking stats and spinning them to fit your agenda. It's pathetic, really. You're so busy trying to 'protect' your little world that you're missing out on the beauty of diversity. But hey, keep living in your little bubble of fear. The rest of us will be over
